2.text: Draw a triangle in the center of the top of your squash.

3.text: Draw two circles slightly above the triangle.

4.text: Draw two, darker circles inside of the circles already drawn.

5.text: Draw a squiggle-line extending from the triangle.

6.text: Draw elongated ovals extended from the squash, until it resembles a fan.

7.text: Draw two, even lines extending from the bottom of the turkey.

8.text: Draw two diagonal lines, extending from close to the bottom of the lines.

9.text: Shade your turkey in the desired colors.

12.text: Sketch a small circle on the right side of the big circle.

13.text: Sketch two lines with an angle attached to the body.

14.text: Draw a fan-like structure on the rear part of the turkey.

15.text: Draw the eyes using small circles.

16.text: Draw the neck and the caruncles using curved lines cascading from the beak to the neck.

17.text: Draw the wings using a big fluffy shape with three curved lines for the feathers.

18.text: Using the outline, sketch out the turkey’s body and add the legs.

20.text: Sketch two layers containing a series of curved lines for the turkey’s fan-like tail.

23.text: Draw a big circle for the body and an oblong overlapping the big circle on the right side.

24.text: Add a small circle for the head and connect this to the oblong using two curved lines that serves as the neck.

25.text: Draw lines for a rough outline of the legs and add a triangle on each end for the feet.

26.text: Draw a curved line on the left side of the turkey and a fan-like structure for the tail attached to the curved line.

27.text: Draw the eyes and define the beak.

28.text: Sketch out the body, taking note of the feather patterns.

29.text: Darken the fan-like shape of the turkey’s tail.

30.text: Sketch and define the legs and toes.

31.text: Draw random small strokes all over the turkey’s body for a feathery appearance.

32.text: Erase unnecessary lines and refine the feathers using small curved strokes.

34.text: Draw an oblong with an overlapping big circle below it.

35.text: Draw the details of the turkey’s head using circles and curve lines for the beak.

36.text: Draw details for the wattle and the head.

37.text: Draw the turkey’s hat or toque to look like a cartoon.

38.text: Draw details for the left wing using curve lines and also for the feet.

39.text: Draw the right wing which holds a ladle.

40.text: Draw the turkey’s fan-shaped tail and details for the feathers.

42.text: Color to your liking, then design the background.

44.text: Draw a more flattened and elongated oblong below the first with an inner overlapping oblong.

45.text: Draw the details for the cut head, wings, and butt.

46.text: Draw an oblong near the butt with small circles or oblongs below it.

47.text: Draw the details for the turkey’s leg with a sketch for the leg bone.

48.text: Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.
